revision.comment: (bot) add rhyme syllable count obtained from Rhymes: pages
revision.text: ==English== ===Pronunciation=== * {{rhymes|en|ɛdɪŋ|s=2}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|en|enm|ȝedding}}, {{m|enm|ȝeddynge}}, from {{inh|en|ang|ġiedding}}, {{m|ang|ġiddung}}, {{m|ang|ġeddung||utterance, saying, prophecy, song, poetry, poetical recitation, meter}}, from {{m|ang|ġieddian||to speak formally, discuss, speak with alliteration, recite, sing}}, equivalent to {{suffix|en|yed|ing}}. ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|obsolete}} A [[song]], especially the song of a [[minstrel]]. # {{lb|en|obsolete|or|historical}} A [[popular]] [[tale]] or [[romance]], or a song embodying a popular tale or romance. #* '''2013''', Marcelle Theibaux, ''The Writings of Medieval Women, 2nd Edition: An Anthology'': #*: By the fifteenth century a '''''yedding''''' is glossed as a romance. ===Etymology 2=== From {{m|en|yed}}. ====Verb==== {{head|en|verb form}} # {{present participle of|en|yed|nocat=1}} ===Etymology 3=== From {{inh|en|enm|eorþing||burial, digging}}, from {{m|enm|eorþien||to bury, dig}}, from {{m|enm|eorþe||earth}}, equivalent to {{suffix|en|earth|ing}}. Possibly influenced by {{inh|en|enm|earding||habitation, dwelling}}, from {{m|enm|eard||dwelling, habitation}}, from {{inh|en|ang|eard||native soil, native land, native country, country, province, region, place of residence, dwelling, home, dwelling place, estate, cultivated ground}}. More at {{l|en|earth}}. ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|en|yerding}}, {{l|en|earding}} ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # {{lb|en|UK|_|dialectal}} A [[burrow]]; a [[mole]] or [[rabbit]] [[hole]]. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=ddeginy|eddying}}
